p: A total of 1560 H7N9 cases were reported in China from 2013 to 2017 including 5 epidemic waves with 88% (30/34) provinces involved. The first epidemic wave was from Jan 1st to Sept 30th, 2013, and the subsequent three waves were from Oct 1st of 2013 to Sept 30th of 2014, Oct 1st of 2014 to Sept 30th of 2015, and Oct 1st of 2015 to Sept 30th of 2016. The last wave was from Oct 1st, 2016 to Dec 31st, 2017 [ 1, 22]. The five top cities with the most H7N9 cases were Shanghai, Suzhou, Shenzhen, Guangzhou, and Hangzhou. They located in Yangtze River Delta and Pearl River Delta, which are well-developed cities with large population density (Fig.Â 1).
